items.name: Weaponry
items.entry: 1 {@object scorpio|CallfromtheDeep}

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: {@dice 10d6|1d6} gp per crew plus 250 gp of precious metal ingots

entries: Siren's Trove is one of the many merchant vessels that sails under the pennant of the Scaly Eye Merchant Company. The proprietor of the Scaly Eye is Lhammauntosz, also known as Mother Claws, an ancient bronze dragon who lairs on the island of Orlumbor. Most pirates aren't foolhardy enough to attack a Scaly Eye ship, for fear of the dragon's wrath, but with the Black Armada gaining power, who knows whether the dragon will be enough of a deterrent.

Captain Goldblood runs a tight ship. She transports goods up and down the Sword Coast, mostly between Fireshear and Ironmaster to the larger cities of Waterdeep and Baldur's Gate. This cargo normally consists of shipments of precious metals or weaponry for militias in the larger cities. Sometimes a private shipment of gems, dwarven sculpture, or magic items is aboard too.

The small cog only has a single {@object scorpio|CallfromtheDeep} to protect itself against pirates, but a well-placed shot in the captain's chest solves most problems. Thankfully, the ship is under the protection of Mother Claws, who uses scrying to keep a close eye on her ships. If the Siren's Trove is in trouble, there's a good chance the {@creature Lhammaruntosz|CallfromtheDeep|ancient bronze dragon} will appear to rescue it from whoever was foolhardy enough to attack it.

entries.name: Stormchaser

items.name: Type
items.entry: {@item Caravel|CallfromtheDeep}

items.name: Function
items.entry: Naval

items.name: Crew
items.entry: 15 {@creature priest|mm|priests} of {@deity Talos|Faerûnian|scag}

items.name: Captain
items.entry: Stormlord Arden (LE male Chondathan human {@creature war priest|vgm} of {@deity Talos|Faerûnian|scag} with a {@item javelin of lightning})

items.name: Weaponry
items.entry: 2 {@object ballista|dmg|ballistae}, 1 {@object scorpio|CallfromtheDeep}

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: {@dice 15d6|1d6} gp per crew

entries: The Stormchaser is a close to a floating temple as you can imagine. The great wooden vessel is constructed for the sole purpose of getting as close to storms as possible. Here, in the heart of the tempest, the priests of {@deity Talos|Faerûnian|scag} can commune with their god, gaining insight into the future, how best to destroy their foes, and where the greatest storms will appear for their next sermon. Despite this seemingly foolhardy quest, the Stormchaser has not yet been harmed by a squall, perhaps because the clergy aboard are truly devout.

As well as chasing storms, the caravel plays a lesser role as protector and extorter. The ship is well known along the Sword Coast as a pirate-killer, but Stormlord Arden does this for profit, not for good. If the Stormchaser comes across a pirate vessel, it uses its {@object ballista|dmg|ballistae} to fire swinging chain bolts, which are perfect for shattering masts and tearing sails. Once the pirates are immobilised, the priests call down bolts of lightning to strike the vessel, sinking it to the depths. If the Stormchaser spots other, civilised vessels, it pulls up dangerously close and asks for protection payment. Without the Stormchaser, Stormlord Arden claims, their ships would be raided by pirates and wrecked by storms. A few hundred gold pieces is a fair price.

entries.name: Water's Crown

items.name: Type

items.entry: Rabi Bakran (LE female Calishite human {@creature swashbuckler|vgm} with a pet {@creature flying snake})

items.name: Weaponry
items.entry: 1 {@object cannon}, 1 {@object scorpio|CallfromtheDeep}

items.name: Treasure
items.entry: {@dice 4d6|1d6} gp per crew plus 500 gp in stolen goods

entries: Captain Bakran is one of the Black Network's finest fences. She seems to have contacts up and down the Sword Coast, in the Merchant's Domain of Amn and, of course, in her native Calimshan. Rabi has even visited the far flung continent of Chult, and the dotted islands in between. It was on the isle of Lantan that the gnomish worshippers of {@deity Gond|Faerûnian|scag} outfitted Water's Crown with her cannon, a fiersome tube of iron fashioned in the shape of a dragon's head, that spits great balls of metal in a burst of fire and smoke.

Water's Crown avoids trouble wherever possible. Bribes are it's primary source of escaping combat and detection, but if that doesn't work, the {@object cannon} tends to do the job. Captain Bakran's goal is to get in and out of her pick-up as fast as possible, and into some far away port with haste so she can shift the goods before they're even been reported missing.

entries.name: Ship Maps
entries: You may use the following maps in your private games, or in published products provided you credit the cartographer: JVC Parry - {@link jvcparry.com}

entries.name: Tentrix's Cipher
entries: The characters can discover a copy of {@language Tentrix's Cipher|CallfromtheDeep|Sea King Tentrix's cipher} any time during the adventure that you deem appropriate. It is in no way essential to the plot, and the characters might enjoy trying to work it out for themselves without the help of the cipher. If you want to give characters a hint, consider giving them a few of the letters, rather than the entire cipher.

data.name: Appendix F: Character Options
entries: The following options provide players with new character options; four new races and eleven new feats, all of which have a nautical theme, and can be used in the {@i Call from the Deep} campaign.

entries.name: Character Races
entries: The following character races supplement that options in the {@filter Player's Handbook|races|source=phb} and are rarer in the worlds of D&D than the races in that book are. If you're a player, consult with you DM before using any of the races presented here. While they fit perfectly into a nautical campaign such as {@i Call from the Deep}, your DM might want to consider the implications for their world before adding a new race.

items: {@race Merfolk|CallfromtheDeep}
{@race Sahuagin (Malenti)|CallfromtheDeep}
{@race Sahuagin (Sea Devil)|CallfromtheDeep}
{@race Sea Spawn|CallfromtheDeep}
{@race Aldani|CallfromtheDeep}

entries.name: Character Feats
entries: The following feats are designed for play in a nautical campaign, and offer benefits related to life aboard ships, on the coast, or under the waves. At certain levels, your class gives you the Ability Score Improvement feature. Using the {@variantrule feats|phb|optional feats rule}, you can forgo taking that feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead. You can take each feat only once, unless the feat's description says otherwise. You must meet any prerequisite specified in a feat to take that feat. These feats are supplements to those presented in the {@filter Player's Handbook|feats|source=phb}, and you should check with your DM before taking one.

items: {@feat Beast Tamer|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Cannoneer|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Firearms Expert|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Firearms Master|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Navigator|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Net Master|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Sea Legs|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Spear Specialist|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Stoic|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Submariner|CallfromtheDeep}
{@feat Underwater Archer|CallfromtheDeep}

language.name: Tentrix's Cipher
typicalSpeakers: Pirate Lords of the Black Armada
entries: {@note A substitution cipher invented by {@creature Sea King Tentrix|CallfromtheDeep} to obfuscate {@language Common}.}

The characters can discover a copy of Sea King Tentrix's cipher any time during the adventure that you deem appropriate. It is in no way essential to the plot, and the characters might enjoy trying to work it out for themselves without the help of the cipher. If you want to give characters a hint, consider giving them a few of the letters, rather than the entire cipher.

feat.name: Beast Tamer
entries: You have a great ability to communicate with, and command, beasts. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling} skill, if you don't already have it.

If you succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check on a beast, the subject of your check serves you for one hour. The beast can perform simple tasks, such as carry messages, guard doorways, or serve as a mount.

feat.name: Cannoneer
entries: You have spent significant time operating siege equipment, earning you the following benefits:

items: You add your proficiency bonus to attack and damage rolls using siege weapons.
If a siege weapon would require an action to aim, you can use a bonus action instead.
During a short rest, provided you have access to {@item carpenter's tools|phb} or similar equipment, you can restore {@dice 1d10} hit points to a siege weapon.

feat.name: Firearms Expert
entries: Thanks to substantial practice with firearms, you gain the following benefits:

items: You ignore the loading quality of {@filter firearms|items|type=firearm} with which you are proficient.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with a {@filter one-handed weapon|items|type=Melee Weapon|property=!Two-handed}, you can use a bonus action to attack with a loaded {@item pistol} you are holding.

feat.name: Firearms Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with one or more firearms, and mastered the use of smokepowder in these weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item pistol} and {@item musket}.

feat.name: Navigator
entries: You have developed the skills necessary to assist navigation at land and sea. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have proficiency in {@item navigator's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient in {@item navigator's tools|phb}, you can add a bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier to any checks made while using them.
If you can see the stars or sun, you know which way is north.
You can tell which way the weather, including wind and temperature, is going to turn in the next 24 hours.

feat.name: Net Master
entries: Extensive training with {@item net|phb|nets} has earned you the following benefits:

items: You don't suffer disadvantage when attack a creature within 5 feet of you with a net, or when throwing a net up to its long range.
You can add your proficiency bonus to the DC, AC, and damage requirement for escaping or destroying your nets.
When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with a net, you can use a bonus action to attack with a {@filter one-handed weapon|items|type=Melee Weapon|property=!Two-handed} you are holding.

feat.name: Sea Legs
entries: Your time spent aboard boats has earned you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in {@filter vehicles (water)|items|type=Vehicle (water)}
You have advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}.
Climbing doesn't cost you extra movement.

feat.name: Spear Specialist
entries: You have trained to become a deadly warrior with pole weapons, capable of making lunging attacks and long-distance throws. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use a {@item javelin|phb}, {@item spear|phb}, or {@item trident|phb}, its damage die changes from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}, and from a {@dice d8} to a {@dice d10} when wielded with two hands, if possible (this feature has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die).
As a bonus action, you can extend the reac of your javelin, spear, or trident by 5 feet.
You can make a ranged attack with a javelin, spear, or trident up to its long range without disadvantage, even underwater.

feat.name: Stoic
entries: You are resilient to fear-incuding effects, and are stoic in the face of horror. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition frightened} or gaining madness effects.

feat.name: Submariner
entries: Your time spent training beneath the waves has earned you the following benefits:

items: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You add your proficiency bonus to the number of minutes for which you can hold your breath.
You add a your proficiency bonus to the number of rounds you can survive after running out of breath.

feat.name: Underwater Archer
entries: You have spent extensive time using ranged weapons under water, and have mastered their trajectories:

items: Your ranged weapon attacks do not automatically mis beyond their normal range underwater.
You don't suffer disadvantage while making ranged weapon attacks within their normal range underwater.

item.name: Cursed Ring of Shooting Stars
entries: While wearing this ring in dim light or darkness, you can cast {@spell dancing lights} and {@spell light} from the ring at will. Casting either spell from the ring requires an action.
The ring has 6 charges for the following other properties. The ring regains {@dice 1d6} expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Faerie Fire
entries: You can expend 1 charge as an action to cast {@spell faerie fire} from the ring.

entries.name: Ball Lightning
entries: You can expend 2 charges as an action to create one to four 3-foot-diameter spheres of lightning. The more spheres you create, the less powerful each sphere is individually.

Each sphere appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of you. The spheres last as long as you concentrate (as if concentrating on a spell), up to 1 minute. Each sphere sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius.

As a bonus action, you can move each sphere up to 30 feet, but no farther than 120 feet away from you. When a creature other than you comes within 5 feet of a sphere, the sphere discharges lightning at that creature and disappears. That creature must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes lightning damage based on the number of spheres you created.

entries.name: Shooting Stars
entries: You can expend 1 to 3 charges as an action. For every charge you expend, you launch a glowing mote of light from the ring at a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature within a 15-foot cube originating from that point is showered in sparks and must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d4} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Curse
entries: {@homebrew This ring is cursed, a fact that is revealed only when an {@spell identify} spell is cast on the ring or you attune to it. Attuning to ring curses you until you are targeted by the {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic; removing the ring fails to end the curse. While cursed you have vulnerability to psychic damage.|Any creature attuned to this ring gains vulnerability to psychic damage.}

item.name: Cursed Gold Coin
entries: This gold coin is minted with a skull on its 'head' and crossbones on its 'tail'. The gold coin is worth the same amount as a normal gold piece and could be melted down into gold bars or swapped for 'normal' gold pieces at a money changer.

entries.name: Curse
entries: The gold piece is cursed, a fact revealed only when an {@spell identify} spell is cast on the coin, or after the effects of the curse become apparent. Casting {@spell detect magic} reveals an aura of necromancy around the gold. Any creature that carries the gold for an hour or more is cursed. The curse can only be removed by {@spell remove curse} or similar magic, and does not end if the creature disposes of the gold.

Pendant la durée de la malédiction, le type de la créature devient mort-vivant. En {@dice 1d4} jours, la créature perd tout appétit pour la nourriture et la boisson et n'en a plus besoin pour survivre. Après {@dice 1d4} jours, la créature perd tout besoin d'air ou de sommeil. {@dice 1d4} jours après, la chair de la créature commence à se détacher de ses os, ne laissant qu'un squelette nu. Ce processus prend {@dice 1d10} jours et, bien que légèrement douloureux et grotesque, n'a aucun effet sur les points de vie de la créature. Une fois la transformation terminée, la créature gagne les changements suivants :

items: Leur score de Dextérité augmente de 2.
Leur score de force diminue de 2.
Leur score de Charisme diminue de 4.
Ils gagnent une vulnérabilité aux dégâts de matraquage et une immunité aux dégâts de poison.
Ils ne peuvent pas être {@condition poisoned}, ou gagner des niveaux de {@condition exhaustion}.
Ils gagnent le sens {@sense darkvision} jusqu'à une portée de 60 pieds.
Ce sont des morts-vivants.

item.name: Potion of Swimming
entries: For 1 hour after drinking this potion, you can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.
{@note This item isn't officially described in the source; it is a guess at the author's intention.}

item.name: The Voyage
entries: This caravel is owned by Lord Neverember and has a crew of fifteen {@creature commoner|mm|commoners} led by {@creature Captain Arveene Greysail|CallfromtheDeep} (NG female Tethyrian human {@creature swashbuckler|vgm}).

item.name: Tulkhan's Map
entries: A faithful map of the Nelanthers which gives characters advantage on checks made to navigate and avoid hazards while in a ship near the islands. The map once belonged {@adventure Tulkhan|CallfromtheDeep|7|Sea Tower of Irphong}.

entries.name: Crew
entries: The caravel has a crew of eight {@creature lizardfolk}, two {@creature ogre|mm|ogres}, and five human {@creature thug|mm|thugs}.

entries.name: Weaponry
entries: The caravel is armed with {@object side-shears|CallfromtheDeep} and two {@object ballista|dmg|ballistae}.

items.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

items.name: Side-shears
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage.

item.name: Token of Disguise
entries: This iron amulet is embossed with a spider emblem. While wearing this token, you can use an action to cast the {@spell disguise self} spell from it at will. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

item.name: Ward Token
entries: A creature carrying a ward token is unaffected by the {@spell antimagic field} in the Broken Goblet (see "{@adventure Roaringshore|CallfromtheDeep|7|Roaringshore|0}" in chapter 3 of {@i Call from the Deep}).

item.name: Lhammaruntosz's Wand of Fireballs
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell fireball} spell (save DC 15) from it, dealing acid instead of fire damage. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

entries.name: Guardian
entries: The item whispers warnings to its bearer, granting a +2 bonus to initiative if the bearer isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

item.name: Dreadcutter
entries: Dreadcutter is a galleon that bristles with weaponry and flies a black pennant.

entries.name: Speed (per turn)
entries: 25 feet

entries.name: Weaponry
entries: Dreadcutter is equipped with two {@object ballista|dmg|ballistae}, a {@object mangonel}, and a {@object ram}, and can make one attack with each per turn. {@note Galleons have 5 weapon slots, so an additional weapon could be installed at the DM's discretion.}

items.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

items.name: Mangonel
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft. (can't hit targets within 60 feet of it), one target. {@h} 27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one object. {@h} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Dreadcutter is a sentient chaotic evil ship with an Intelligence of {@d20 3|16}, a Wisdom of {@d20 0|10}, and a Charisma of {@d20 4|18}. It has hearing out to a range of 120 feet.
The ship can speak and read {@language Common}, and communicate telepathically with any creature within 120 feet of it in a malicious, snarky tone.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Dreadcutter is arrogant and egotistic, desiring nothing more than to become the most feared pirate vessel on the Sword Coast. The ship was created when a drow wizard took her life aboard the galleon. Her soul lingers in the ship but retains no memory of her life.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: A character can attune to and interact with Dreadcutter as if it were a sentient weapon, though Dreadcutter attempts to take control of its wielder if it doesn't sink at least one ship per tenday.

item.name: Clawed Gauntlet
entries: A character proficient with {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} is considered proficient with the gauntlets.

item.name: Scarlet Marpenoth
entries: The Scarlet Marpenoth has a crew of five {@creature drow elite warrior|mm|drow elite warriors}.
{@note The Scarlet Marpenoth is a submarine. Additional information can be found in {@adventure chapter 7|wdh|8|Submarine Features|0} of {@i Waterdeep: Dragon Heist}.}

item.name: The Flying Squid
entries: The Flying Squid is a sailing ship powered by a {@creature water elemental} which is bound to a gyroscopic adamantine prison in the hold. Successfully binding the elemental requires a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check.

item.name: Aslaug Waveborn's Spear
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Waterborne
entries: This item floats on water and other liquids. Its bearer has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to swim.

item.name: Baragsh's +3 Adamantine Glaive
entries: A {@item +3 adamantine glaive|CallfromtheDeep} whose green blade is banded and mottled in a pattern reminiscent of astral skies. It belonged to Baragsh—a male orc captain of a spacefaring vessel from the Astral Plane. A creature attuned to the weapon gains proficiency in vehicles (air), and can add their proficiency bonus to checks made to navigate in the Astral Plane.

entries.name: +3 Adamantine Glaive
entries: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

item.name: Captain Tharhava Shestendeliath's Scimitar of Speed
entries: A {@item scimitar of speed} that belonged to Captain Tharhava Shestendeliath—a non-binary blue dragonborn swashbuckler. A creature attuned to the weapon becomes obsessively driven by the draconian voice in their mind commanding them to avenge their death at the hands of Tharcereli. The creature cannot unattune to the weapon, and are unwillig to part with it until Tharcereli is killed. In addition, they gain the breath weapon of a blue {@race dragonborn} (see chapter 2 of the {@i Player's Handbook}).

entries.name: Scimitar of Speed
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns.

item.name: Tallyn Amberheart's Flame Tongue Longsword
entries: A {@item flame tongue longsword} which belonged to a Tallyn Amberheart—a human paladin of The Red Knight. Those who wield it hear a commanding woman's voice in their mind instructing during combat. Once per long rest, a creature attuned to the blade can use a bonus action to cause an ally within 30 feet of them that can hear them to use their reaction to make a melee weapon attack.

entries.name: Flame Tongue
entries: You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.

item.name: Werydd Giantsbane's Giant Slayer Greataxe
entries: A {@item giant slayer greataxe} which belonged to Werydd Giantsbane—a shield dwarf champion. A creature attuned to the weapon grows ginger braids and swells in girth. They also gain advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Giant Slayer
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a giant with it, the giant takes an extra {@damage 2d6} slashing damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. For the purpose of this weapon, "giant" refers to any {@filter creature with the giant type|bestiary|type=giant}, including ettins and trolls.

item.name: Crystal Skull
entries: The skull can be used to cast the {@spell speak with dead} spell once per day.

item.name: Black Candle
entries: A black candle with an illusory flame that extinguishes all nonmagical light sources in a room when snuffed.

item.name: Drow Slippers of Spider Climbing
entries: While you wear these light shoes, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the slippers don't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.
This item loses its enchantment permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

item.name: Delver's Armour
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armour. While wearing the armour underwater, you can speak {@homebrew its|it's} command word as an action to create a bubble of air around your head. It allows you to breathe normally underwater. This bubble stays with you until you speak the command word again, you doff the armour, or you are no longer underwater

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Aquamarine Dolphin
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature dolphin|vgm|Aquamarine Dolphin}.
The aquamarine dolphin can become a {@creature dolphin|vgm} for up to 6 hours. While in dolphin form, the figurine allows you to cast the {@spell water breathing} spell at will.

item.name: Marid Conch
entries: This iridescent pink conch shell weighs 1 pound. When you use an action to rub the conch, a cloud of thick sea mist flows out of the shell. At the end of your turn, the mist disappears with a flash of harmless lightning, and a {@creature marid} appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.
The first time the shell is rubbed, the DM rolls to determine what happens.

rows: The {@creature marid} attacks you. After fighting for 5 rounds, the {@creature marid} disappears, and the conch loses its magic.

The {@creature marid} serves you for 1 hour, doing as you command. The marid then returns to the conch. The conch can't be activated again for 24 hours. The next two times the conch is used, the same effect occurs. If the conch is opened a fourth time, the {@creature marid} escapes and disappears, and the conch loses its magic.
The {@creature marid} can cast the {@spell wish} spell three times for you. It disappears when it grants the wish or after 1 hour, and the conch loses its magic.

item.name: Psionic Suit
entries: This item appears to be a Large suit of {@item plate armor|phb|plate armour} weighing 250 lbs. The suit has a hatch at the rear, through which one creature can enter using an action. That creature becomes the pilot.
The psionic suit is a Large object with the following statistics:

items.name: Speed:
items.entry: fly 3 × the pilot's Intelligence score

items.name: Damage Immunities:
items.entry: poison, psychic

entries: Once inside the pilot can operate the suit through thought. The suit has two {@action Attack} options, both of which require an action:

items: Make two gauntlet attacks, with a bonus to the attack roll equal to the pilot's Intelligence score, dealing 11 ({@damage 2d10}) plus the pilot's Intelligence score bludgeoning damage on a hit. The suit can forego the damage to grapple a target (escape DC equals 10 plus the creature's Intelligence score).

Attempt to explode a creature's brain. One creature the pilot can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw. The DC equals 10 + the pilot's Intelligence modifier. The target takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

entries: Any ability check or saving throw made by the suit has a bonus equal to the pilot's Intelligence score, plus their proficiency bonus if applicable.
A pilot with spellcasting (psionics) adds their proficiency to any {@dice d20} roll made by the suit, and can cast their spells through the suit.

item.name: Staff of the Eel
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, or warlock
entries: You can use an action to speak this staff's command word and throw the staff on the ground within 10 feet of you. The staff becomes a {@creature giant lightning eel|tftyp} under your control and acts on its own initiative count. By using a bonus action to speak the command word again, you return the staff to its normal form in a space formerly occupied by the eel.

On your turn, you can mentally command the eel if it is within 60 feet of you and you aren't incapacitated. You decide what action the eel takes and where it moves during its next turn, or you can issue it a general command, such as to attack your enemies or guard a location.

If the eel is reduced to 0 hit points, it dies and reverts to its staff form. The staff then shatters and is destroyed. If the eel reverts to staff form before losing all its hit points, it regains all of them.

entries: You have resistance to cold damage while attuned to this tome, you can breathe underwater, and you have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

The tome has 10 charges, While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell control water} (4 charges), {@spell create or destroy water} (1 charge), {@spell maelstrom|xge} (5 charges), {@spell tidal wave|xge} (3 charges), {@spell wall of water|xge} (3 charges), {@spell water breathing} (3 charges), {@spell water walk} (3 charges), {@spell watery sphere|xge} (4 charges), {@spell tsunami} (8 charges).
The tome regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the tome turns to water, pours through your fingers, and is destroyed

The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries: If the elder brain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and takes 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The elder brain can have up to four targets {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The elder brain magically emits psychic energy. Creatures of the elder brain's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or take 32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Psychic Link
entries: The elder brain targets one {@condition incapacitated} creature it can perceive with its Creature Sense trait and establishes a psychic link with that creature. Until the psychic link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. The target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it is no longer {@condition incapacitated}, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the psychic link, doing so with a successful {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. The psychic link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 5 miles apart, with no consequences to the target. The elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

action.name: Sense Thoughts
entries: The elder brain targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain gains insight into the target's reasoning, its emotional state, and thoughts that loom large in its mind (including things the target worries about, loves, or hates). The elder brain can also make a Charisma (Deception) check with advantage to deceive the target's mind into thinking it believes one idea or feels a particular emotion. The target contests this attempt with a Wisdom (Insight) check. If the elder brain succeeds, the mind believes the deception for 1 hour or until evidence of the lie is presented to the target.

legendary.name: Sever Psychic Link

Doté d'un intellect inimaginable et d'une volonté de fer, Zellix'Phor est un Cerveau Ancien dont l'équivalent n'a pas été vu sur le Plan Matériel depuis des siècles, voire jamais. Zellix'Phor est déterminé à reconstruire l'empire illithid autour d'eux-mêmes et de leur colonie, et aussi à exterminer les gith restants. L'aîné des cerveaux est arrogant et se croit invincible, incapable d'être surpassé ou surclassé.

Après le crash, Zellix'Phor a ressenti la peur pour la première fois. Les Gith avaient détruit leur colonie, à l'exception d'une poignée de disciples mineurs et de leurs accompagnateurs. Heureusement, les fidèles acolytes de Zellix'Phor ont risqué leur vie pour leur trouver un vaisseau adéquat à occuper : la tête de Slarkrethel le Kraken.

La bataille psionique en cours entre le cerveau aîné et le kraken a ravivé la soif de domination de Zellix'Phor, et le cerveau aîné a envoyé ses agents sur la Côte des Épées pour rapporter les cerveaux de ses habitants, et les délicieuses connaissances qu'ils contiennent.

Puissant lanceur de sorts et aspect de {@deity Umberlee|Faerûnian|scag}, Slarkrethel avait de nombreux adeptes sur la Côte d'Épée et dans les royaumes insulaires, aussi bien au sein de la Société du Kraken que parmi les adeptes informels comme ceux des Roches Pourpres. Maintenant que Zellix'Phor a le contrôle du kraken, l'ancien cerveau a la capacité de manipuler télépathiquement et psioniquement ces agents à sa volonté, et de faire avancer le Grand Dessein.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Tous les êtres doivent se soumettre à la volonté de Zellix'Phor. Je répandrai mon influence à travers ce nouveau monde.

entries.name: Bond
entries: Rien n'est plus important que de reconstruire notre empire perdu, sauf, peut-être, l'extermination des Gith.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: Zellix'Phor est invincible. Zellix'Phor est indomptable. Zellix'Phor est omnipotent.

entries.name: The Colony of Zellix'Phor
entries: Zellix'Phor est un ancien cerveau ancien, qui se souvient de la destruction de l'empire illithid. Grâce à l'absorption de cerveaux illithids morts, Zellix'Phor a appris à connaître les causes de la chute de l'empire et est obsédé par la vengeance. Poussée par la soif de sang, la colonie illithid qui suit Zellix'Phor cherche à travers les Plans d'Existence des crèches githyanki, espérant décimer leur population par l'infanticide.

Zellix'Phor était devenu un nom qui enthousiasmait les Mind Flayers et faisait naître l'effroi dans le cœur des Gith. Son effet dévastateur sur la population githyanki était bien connu, et des histoires horribles étaient racontées au sein de cette culture sur l'arrivée silencieuse et mortelle du vaisseau illithid qui abritait Zellix'Phor et ses disciples.

Avec le temps, la colonie de Zellix'Phor s'est développée au point de pouvoir à peine subvenir à ses besoins. Tout l'espace nautiloïde disponible a été consacré aux illithids, et leurs esclaves ont été jetés pour faire de la place à la race supérieure. Le besoin de cerveaux pour alimenter les Mind Flayers signifiait que le nautiloïde dans lequel vivait la colonie visitait le plan matériel de plus en plus fréquemment. Malgré les générations de connaissances de guerre tactique assimilées par le Zellix'Phor, son arrogance est devenue sa perte. Le gith avait suivi le nautiloïde à travers les Plans, attendant le bon moment pour frapper. Se croyant invincible, Zellix'Phor ordonna au vaisseau d'accoster sur le Plan Matériel pour faire le plein de cervelle, et le vaisseau fut attaqué.

Les chevaliers Githyanki, les guerriers les plus féroces et les plus redoutables de la race martiale, ont frappé le nautiloïde avec une force incommensurable. Ils sont entrés dans le vaisseau comme des assassins et ont décimé l'illithid à l'intérieur. Sans leurs esclaves pour porter le poids de l'assaut, les Mind Flayers étaient en première ligne, et malgré leurs formidables capacités psioniques, beaucoup ont été abattus par les épées d'argent des Githyanki. Le nautiloïde s'est écrasé sur l'île nordique de Gundarlun, tuant presque tous ceux qui étaient à bord. Malheureusement, Zellix'Phor et ses plus proches compagnons ont réussi à survivre, à l'abri de la destruction dans la chambre du cerveau aîné du nautiloïde. En ce qui concerne les Githyanki, la mission suicide a été un succès.

Despite the enormous sail atop Tentrix's lair, the construction of the vessel renders it almost immobile. Thankfully, Tentrix bought the loyalty of Kharon, a {@creature merrenoloth|mtf} capable of captaining any ship. The ship counts as the merrenoloth's lair, and they can use their lair actions and regional effects here. Kharon enjoys life aboard the ship. They're paid well, and the riotous lifestyle of the humans aboard amuses them. Despite their loyalty to the ship, Kharon's contract specifies that they are under no obligation to fight in the ship's defence.

Despite her stature, Grabbit holds great sway on the ship. Most of the crew aboard are monstrous and respond better to her orders than those from the pirate lords or Tentrix himself. Her command over the crew comes from her ruthlessness; she has a deadly habit of kicking crew who question her authority off the plank (see {@adventure area t1|CallfromtheDeep|T1. Top Deck|0}) down to the zombie tank ({@adventure area t12|CallfromtheDeep|T12. Hold|0}) where they're torn apart by the undead ogre within.

She wields a {@item whip|phb} instead of a {@item scimitar|phb}, and can multiattack without disadvantage.

She is perpetually covered with soot and sawdust. She wears a pair of eyes of minute seeing and a thick leather robe puckered with burn holes, and is rarely seen without a pipe in her mouth.
Powder uses the statistics of a {@creature swashbuckler|vgm} with the following changes:

Her alignment is chaotic neutral.
Her speed is 25 feet.
She has {@sense darkvision} out to 60 feet.
She has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.
She can speak {@language Common} and {@language Gnomish}.
She wields a {@item musket} instead of a {@item rapier|phb} ({@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage.).

After being ousted from her Chultan lair by {@creature Ras Nsi|toa}, Desecratus Profanis managed to take control of a ship merchant ship leaving Chult. Discovering she had a taste for piracy, she began raiding other vessels on their way to and from peninsula, amassing a hoard of wealth and magic items. Seeking greater influence over the seas, Desecratus travelled north to the Sword Coast where she made a habit of sinking Lord's Alliance vessels, which brought her to the attention of Tentrix. Although the pair initially tried to destroy each other, Desecratus saw something in Tentrix when he commanded the ocean, revealing his connection to Slarkrethel. Seeing potential for her own arcane gains, Desecratus has allied with the Sea King and serves as a pirate lord under his command, hoping one day to unlock the powers he has been afforded by the kraken.

Desecratus Profanis is a schemer. She chafes under Tentrix's command, but realises the Black Armada comes with protection and power she could not otherwise enjoy. She assists Tentrix for now, but takes note whenever the kraken priest communes with Slarkrethel and will strike when the time is right. She is willing to make deals with characters to bring down Tentrix, provided she is replaced as commander of the Black Armada. Her ability to reform after death ensures this, even if she is betrayed.

Desecratus is a fourteen foot long, purple serpent with a woman's face and blood-red markings on her hood. She talks slowly and carefully with a lisping rattle. She wears an eyepatch, covering the eye she lost in a fight with {@creature Ras Nsi|toa}.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "I must amass enough power to returl to Chult and destroy Ras Nsi."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "My only loyalty is to myself. If Tentrix shows a sign of weakness, I'll strike."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I'm extremely proud and believe I deserve the utmost respect. A slight against me will not be forgotten."

Most slaadi are agents of pure chaos that hail from the Plane of Limbo. When slaadi travel to the Material Plane, they create carnage by transforming humanoids into more of their kind. Years ago, Tentrix's vessel came across a town under attack. The pirate flew into a rage after realising his raid could no longer occur, so kidnapped a slaadi in order to ransom them back. When his first mate was killed before the message could be delivered, Tentrix realised the foolishness of his plan. He then tried to kill the slaad, but his blade hit the control gem embedded in its head which he removed, gaining control over the chaotic creature.

Thenceforth the slaad has obeyed Tentrix, who found he could teach it many things, including how to captain a ship. Eventually, the slaad became a notorious pirate in its own right, adopting the identity of Captain Scummer. Tentrix elevated the creature to pirate lord after Scummer sunk a Flaming Fist vessel chasing his own. Scummer would rather not be controlled by Tentrix but has no ambition to retrieve the control gem himself. If the characters retrieve the gem, the slaad accepts their control.

Captain Scummer looks like a bloated, bipedal, green toad with a gaping maw and heavy brow. Scummer's identity as pirate captain is reflected in its choice of attire; a bright red frock coat. Scummer wields an oar, adorned with fish skulls, as its staff. Although Scummer can shapeshift into humanoid form, it does so only to avoid certain death or when commanded to do so by Tentrix.

entries.name: Bond

entries.name: Flaw

Tulkhan is a Red Wizard of Thay who fled to the Nelanthers after the thayan operations in Daggerford failed. Since arriving, he has hired pirate crews to kidnap babies from the mainland, which he used in a dark ritual to reanimate the dragon turtle known as the Curse of Irphong. After a few Black Armada vessels were sunk in Asavir's Channel by the beast, Sea King Tentrix contacted Tulkhan and asked whether he'd work for the Black Armada by getting the dragon turtle to sink Lords' Alliance warships and merchant vessels passing through the Nelanthers. In return, Tentrix ensures that word doesn't reach Daggerford about the Red Wizard's location.

Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. Au large de la côte se trouve un ensemble de petits îlots connus sous le nom de Red Rocks. La plupart de ces formes de relief sont des empilements marins sculptés par les vagues de la mer des Épées, mais certains ne sont guère plus que des rochers qui dépassent des vagues. Les rochers rouges ont coulé d'innombrables navires au cours des siècles, aussi les marins ont-ils tendance à les éviter. Les pêcheurs à bord de plus petits bateaux fréquentent cependant ces eaux, car la région abrite de nombreux coquillages, dont plusieurs sont prisés à Waterdeep.

The merfolk here are more aggressive than other communities of their kind and collect tolls from ships that pass by. The reason for the aggressive nature of the merfolk has been speculated about by sailors for perhaps hundreds of years, but few know the truth. Red Rocks was once a kraken hatchery, where the monolithic beasts stored their eggs. The local merfolk were corrupted by the evil influence of the leviathans and were forced to serve as guards and caretakers for the newly born krakens. Although no eggs have been left here for centuries, the merfolk still pledge allegiance to the krakens, specifically to Slarkrethel.

action.name: Tail

action.name: Frightful Presence

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Lightning Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales lightning in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 ({@damage 16d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Repulsion Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales repulsion energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 60 feet away from the dragon.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monster.name: Mei Ling
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny quipper or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in quipper form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 0 feet, and it has a swimming speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Underwater Domain
entries: Les courants naturels de l'océan ne sont pas considérés comme de l'eau courante pour toutes les caractéristiques de Mei Ling.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Vicious Greatsword (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. When Mei Ling rolls a 20 with this magic weapon, the target takes an extra {@footnote 7 slashing damage|According to the SRD, it is an extra {@damage 2d6} slashing damage.}.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a {@creature vampire spawn} under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 2d4} swarms of {@creature swarm of bats||bats} or {@creature swarm of rats||rats}, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call {@dice 3d6} {@creature wolf||wolves} instead. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.
{@homebrew At the DM's discretion, Mei Ling can alternatively summon swarms of {@creature swarm of quippers||quippers}, or call upon {@creature reef shark||reef sharks} instead of wolves.}

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Luring Song
entries: The harpy sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. The harpy must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the harpy is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by the harpy, a target is {@condition incapacitated} and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the harpy, the target must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy's song for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Divine Eminence
entries: As a bonus action, the priest can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priest expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the aarakocra is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 3 ({@dice 1d6}) damage to the target.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Summon Air Elemental
entries: Five aarakocra within 30 feet of each other can magically summon an {@creature air elemental}. Each of the five must use its action and movement on three consecutive turns to perform an aerial dance and must maintain concentration while doing so (as if concentrating on a spell). When all five have finished their third turn of the dance, the elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of them. It is friendly toward them and obeys their spoken commands. It remains for 1 hour, until it or all its summoners die, or until any of its summoners dismisses it as a bonus action. A summoner can't perform the dance again until it finishes a short rest. When the elemental returns to the Elemental Plane of Air, any aarakocra within 5 feet of it can return with it.

entries: L'hippocampe peut respirer de l'air et de l'eau.

entries: The deep scion can use its action to polymorph into a humanoid-piscine hybrid form, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The deep scion reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The deep scion can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Hideous Transformation
entries: When the deep scion is first attacked, it undergoes a hideous transformation. Each creature that sees the transformation must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or gain a random form of short-term madness, determined by rolling on the {@table Short-Term Madness} table in {@variantrule madness|dmg|chapter 8} of the {@i Dungeon Master's Guide}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In humanoid form, the deep scion makes two melee attacks. In hybrid form, the deep scion makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: +1 Dagger (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Psychic Screech (Hybrid Form Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The deep scion emits a terrible scream audible within 300 feet. Creatures within 30 feet of the deep scion must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the deep scion's next turn. In water, the psychic screech also telepathically transmits the deep scion's memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as it and its master are in the same body of water.

Deep scions began life as people who were stolen from shore or saved from sinking ships and offered a terrible bargain by an undersea power: surrender, body and soul, or drown. Those who submit are subjected to an ancient ritual widespread among evil aquatic creatures. Its methods are painful and the result never certain, but when it works, the magic transforms an air-breathing person into a shapechanger that can take a form that is fully at home beneath the waves.

entries.name: Spies from the Sea
entries: A deep scion emerges from the depths in service to its underwater master, which is likely a kraken or some other ancient being of the deep. While wearing the mind and body of the person it once was as a sort of mask, the creature is bent on fulfilling its master's desires. Sometimes a deep scion returns to its former home and a hero's welcome-unexpectedly found alive when all hope was lost. At other times the deep scion takes on a new identity. In any case, it is the deep scion's duty to infiltrate the air-breathing world and report back to its master. When set to its task, a deep scion worms its way into the life of an unsuspecting enemy as a new best friend, an irresistible lover, the perfect candidate for a job, or in some other role that enables the minion to carry out its master's commands.

entries.name: Cold-Hearted Killers
entries: The training to which a deep scion is subjected rids it of empathy for those whom it spies on. Though one might behave as though infatuated, laugh at the joke of a friend, or appear incensed at some injustice, each of these acts is artificial to the deep scion, a means to an end. It believes that its true form is the shape it takes when it returns to the sea that it thinks of as home. Ironically, however, a deep scion that is killed when in its piscine form is stripped of the magic that robbed it of emotion, leaving behind the corpse of the person the deep scion once was.
If you meet a human and there's something fishy about them, they might be a deep scion. Or a crook, or just a fishmonger. Sometimes fish stink is just fish stink.

While the soul is bodiless, a {@spell wish} spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

entries: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy

L'aboleth Kzixxaro réside dans les voûtes inférieures. Cette créature est originaire du royaume lointain. Elle est arrivée sur le plan matériel avec la souveraineté abolethique. Leur objectif est d'ouvrir un portail vers le royaume lointain, permettant à leurs ancêtres inimaginables d'entrer dans le plan matériel. À court terme, cela implique de corrompre d'importants citoyens de Neverwinter pour accéder à une plus grande magie.

Au cours des dernières décennies, la souveraineté a été en déclin. Des conflits avec d'autres sociétés ont forcé les dirigeants à se réfugier dans l'Underdark, où ils sont mieux à même de se défendre. Kzixxaro reste à Neverwinter pour continuer à observer la ville. Kzixxaro a plusieurs agents à Neverwinter, dont le frère Atlavast et le maire Soman Galt. Ces deux-là ont été manipulés par Kzixxaro en leur promettant leurs désirs, et en utilisant {@spell phantasmal force} pour les imiter lorsqu'ils reviennent avec des informations.

Unfortunately for Kzixxaro, it's powerful telepathic influence in Neverwinter has not gone unnoticed. When Zellix'Phor merged with Slarkrethel, the elder brain realised the potential threat Kzixxaro could pose should it gain sway over Neverwinter and return the Sovereignty to its former power. Because of this, Kraken Society agents were told to pay Garrundar the Vile ({@adventure N12. Pirates' Skyhold|CallfromtheDeep|5|N12. Pirate's Skyhold}) for his undead pirate mercenaries. They aim to attack the House of Knowledge and kill Kzixxaro, thus eliminating a potential enemy of the Colony of Zellix'Phor.

entries: If the troll finishes a short or long rest without reattaching a severed limb or head, the part regrows. At that point, the severed part dies. Until then, a severed part acts on the troll's initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 13, 10 hit points, and the troll's Regeneration trait.
A severed leg is unable to attack and has a speed of 5 feet.

A severed arm has a speed of 5 feet and can make one claw attack on its turn, with disadvantage on the attack roll unless the troll can see the arm and its target. Each time the troll loses an arm, it loses a claw attack.

If its head is severed, the troll loses its bite attack and its body is {@condition blinded} unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of 0 feet and the troll's Keen Smell trait. It can make a bite attack but only against a target in its space.

The troll's speed is halved if it's missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls {@condition prone}. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I always believe I can escape."

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Callous' spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Demands of Nessus
entries: At the start of each of Callous' turns, he can choose one ally he can see within 30 feet of him. The chosen ally loses 10 hit points, and Callous regains the same number of hit points. If Callous is {@condition incapacitated}, he makes no choice; instead, the closest ally within 30 feet is the chosen ally.

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: Callous' AC includes his Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Firearm Expert
entries: Callous has had extensive practice with firearms, giving him the following benefits:

items: He ignores the loading quality of firearms with which he is proficient.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on his ranged attack rolls.
If he makes an attack with a one-handed weapon, he can use a bonus action to attack with a loaded firearm he is holding.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: Callous can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonsu action on each of his turns.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: While wearing his {@item mantle of spell resistance}, Callous has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Callous deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Callous that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Callous doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Callous wears a {@item cap of water breathing}, {@item gloves of swimming and climbing}, and a {@item mantle of spell resistance}. While wearing the gloves, climbing and swimming don't cost him extra movement, and he has a +5 bonus to Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb or swim.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Callous makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Summon Devil (1/Day)
entries: Callous summons {@dice 1d4} {@creature bearded devil|mm|bearded devils} with no chance of failure.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Callous adds 3 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Callous must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Colony Resistance
entries: The coelenite has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that target only it.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The coelenite can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if the coelenite has half of its hit points or fewer. A target hit by the attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The coelenite has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

A coelenite (pronounced {@i SEE-len-ite}) is a roughly humanoid coral-like creature made of hundreds of thousands of tiny organisms no larger than a pebble. The tiny creatures that make up a coelenite are brightly coloured and amorphous, but when they group together in a colony they harden like coral and take on a more structured form. These bodies have crushing claws akin to those of a giant crab and almost impenetrable armour. In addition, their colonial nature makes them resistant a wide variety of spells and conditions.

entries.name: Water Dependant
entries: Despite their tough exoskeleton, the interior of a coelenite colony is amorphous and mushy. This interior requires a near constant supply of water to remain hydrated. Many sailors claim that the easiest way to kill a coelenite is to lure it inside a cabin and lock it in overnight.

entries.name: Mass Minds
entries: Should enough coelenites come together, they can produce an intelligence above that of a regular colony. These mass minds are capable of commanding other coelenite colonies and even manifesting magical effects. Luckily, if enough of the organisms that form the mass mind are killed, it loses these cognitive qualities.

trait.name: Colony Resistance
entries: The coelenite has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that target only it.

trait.name: Colony Resistance
entries: If the coelenite has half its hit points or fewer its Intelligence score drops to 5 (-3), it can't use its Innate Spellcasting, Limited Telepathy, or Psychic Crush.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The coelenite can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The coelenite can magically tarnsmit simple messages and images to any creature within 60 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond unless that creature is a coelenite.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The coelenite's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if the coelenite has half of its hit points or fewer. A target hit by the attack is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). The coelenite has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Psychic Crush {@recharge 5}
entries: The coelenite targets one creature that it can sense within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
